revised_title: British Fellows of the Royal Society in North Africa and the Levant (1662-1800)
tldr: This article discusses the 12 British Fellows of the Royal Society who were active in North Africa and the Levant between 1662 and 1800. These individuals, mostly native Englishmen, Scots, or Irishmen, contributed to scientific knowledge and communication between the Royal Society and the Mediterranean regions. The article highlights their backgrounds, contributions, and the role they played in the Europeanization process in the region.
